title: View from the Valleys: Blaenau Gwent
text:
The Valleys are steeped in their coal mining history and wherever you go remnants of the past can be seen.
In Blaenau Gwent, one of the most poignant reminders is the Guardian statue at Six Bells. It's Wales' largest mining memorial paying tribute to the 45 men and boys who lost their lives in the Six Bells Colliery disaster in 1960. And it's a sign that while the mines are gone, the mining spirit of yesterday is far from forgotten.
In Tredegar, Parc Bryn Bach used to be an opencast mining site and now provides 340 acres of woodland, park land and a lake for kayaking, canoeing, climbing and walking.
